com.mordoch.chemtools.util

Class Analysis

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.util.Analysis

  • public class Analysis
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains tools for analysis, i.e. finding empirical formula given percent composition.
    Since:
    0.1
    Version:
    0.7
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch
    See Also:
    Main

      • Analysis

    • Method Detail

      • empiricalFromPercentComposition

        public static Formula empiricalFromPercentComposition(double percent1,
                                                      double percent2,
                                                      double percent3,
                                                      java.lang.String element1,
                                                      java.lang.String element2,
                                                      java.lang.String element3)
        This method takes 3 percents and 3 elements and finds the empirical formula for a compound containing those elements (the molar masses of each element are found automatically. The user must provide the element's symbol, i.e. "H").

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with two elements rather than three.
        Parameters:
        percent1 - the percent of element 1 in compound X
        percent2 - the percent of a second element in compound X
        percent3 - the percent of a third element in compound X
        element1 - the symbol, i.e. "H", of the element corresponding to percent1
        element2 - the symbol, i.e. "H", of the element corresponding to percent2
        element3 - the symbol, i.e. "H", of the element corresponding to percent3
        Returns:
        empirical formula without correction for decimal subscripts.
        Since:
        0.1

      • empiricalFromPercentComposition

        public static Formula empiricalFromPercentComposition(double percent1,
                                                      double percent2,
                                                      java.lang.String element1,
                                                      java.lang.String element2)
        This method takes 2 percents and 2 elements and finds the empirical formula for a compound containing those elements (the molar masses of each element are found automatically. The user must provide the element's symbol, i.e. "H").

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with three elements rather than two.
        Parameters:
        percent1 - the percent of element 1 in compound X
        percent2 - the percent of a second element in compound X
        element1 - the symbol, i.e. "H", of the element corresponding to percent1
        element2 - the symbol, i.e. "H", of the element corresponding to percent2
        Returns:
        empirical formula without correction for decimal subscripts.
        Since:
        0.2

      • empiricalFromMass

        public static Formula empiricalFromMass(double mass1,
                                        double mass2,
                                        double mass3,
                                        java.lang.String element1,
                                        java.lang.String element2,
                                        java.lang.String element3)
        This method takes the total mass of a compound and its three elements and determines the empirical formula of that compound. Employs the empiricalFromPercentComposition method to work.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with two elements rather than three.
        Parameters:
        mass1 - the mass of an element in compound X
        mass2 - the mass of a second element in compound X
        mass3 - the mass of a third element in compound X
        element1 - the element that corresponds to mass1
        element2 - the element that corresponds to mass2
        element3 - the element that corresponds to mass3
        Returns:
        empirical formula, without correcting for decimal subscripts
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        empiricalFromPercentComposition(double, double, double, String, String, String)

      • empiricalFromMass

        public static Formula empiricalFromMass(double mass1,
                                        double mass2,
                                        java.lang.String element1,
                                        java.lang.String element2)
        This method takes the total mass of a compound and its two elements and determines the empirical formula of that compound. Employs the empiricalFromPercentComposition method to work.

        Note that this method does not check whether one of the normalized subscripts are decimals.

        An additional method of the same name can find the empirical formula of a compound with three elements rather than two.
        Parameters:
        mass1 - the mass of an element in compound X
        mass2 - the mass of a second element in compound X
        element1 - the element that corresponds to mass1
        element2 - the element that corresponds to mass2
        Returns:
        empirical formula, without correcting for decimal subscripts
        Since:
        0.2
        See Also:
        empiricalFromPercentComposition(double, double, String, String)

      • molecularFromEmpirical

        public static final Formula molecularFromEmpirical(java.lang.String empiricalFormula,
                                                   double molarMassCompound)
        This method takes a formula and the molar mass of a molecular formula and finds the subscripts of the molecular formula. For example, molecularFromEmpirical("CH2O", 180.156) returns [6, 12, 6].
        Parameters:
        empiricalFormula - a chemical formula syntactically compatible with Parser#parseSimpleFormula
        molarMassCompound - the molar mass of a compound
        Returns:
        a Formula representing the molecular formula
        Since:
        0.3

      • empiricalFromMolecular

        public static final Formula empiricalFromMolecular(java.lang.String formula)
        This method finds the empirical formula from a given molecular formula, using GCD. Note that the method used to find GCD, which is based off Euclid's algorithm, can err.
        Parameters:
        formula - a molecular formula
        Returns:
        the empirical formula, in the form of a Formula object

        Computes the percent composition of a formula.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • computeMassComposition

        public static double[] computeMassComposition(java.lang.String formula,
                                              double massOfFormula)
        Computes the mass composition of a formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - a formula, such as "H2O1"
        Returns:
        a double[] containing the mass composition of each element in the formula

      • computeMolarMass

        public static double computeMolarMass(java.lang.String formula)
        Computes the molar mass of a formula.
        Parameters:
        formula - a formula, such as "C6H12O6"
        Returns:
        the molar mass of the given formula

                                 double moles)
        Computes the mass of a formula.

        moles - the moles of the given formula

        Computes the number of atoms in a formula.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • numOfAtomsReactants

        public static int numOfAtomsReactants(java.lang.String equation)
        Computes the number of atoms on the reactants side of a chemical equation.
        Parameters:
        equation - a valid chemical equation
        Returns:
        the number of atoms contained on the reactants side of the equation (the side is insignificant if the equation is balanced)

      • numOfAtomsProducts

        public static int numOfAtomsProducts(java.lang.String equation)
        Computes the number of atoms on the products side of a chemical equation.
        Parameters:
        equation - a valid chemical equation
        Returns:
        the number of atoms contained on the products side of the equation (the side is insignificant if the equation is balanced)
